titleStmt.title: Corn and Language Harran
SHAWI Corpus
titleStmt.funder: Funded by the FWF Austrian Science Fund under the number P 33574

publicationStmt.distributor: Austrian Center for Digital Humanities and Cultural Heritage

prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.

spanGrp.span: The Bedouins, earlier Ismail mentioned the raids. The Bedouins used to raid. The Bedouin, they are not Arabs. Their origin is not Arab. No, they aren’t arabs! The Bedouins are not Arabs.
However, as they speak Arabic, they say, “We are Arabs.” But they are not Arabs. Our ancestors always told us that they are not Arabs. They are Bedouins, but their origins are not Arab.
The origin of the Bedouin is not Arab, they are bandits. – But you are Arabs? – We are real Arabs. We Bani ʕIǧil, for example, we have a pedigree.

Formerly all tribes had a pedigree; it is still from the era of the Ottomans. The family – we call it genealogy ¬– has a genealogy, it writes down the family tree. When you start to write about yourself your father will write for you the family tree. When I want to write it down he will write for me the family tree saying son of Mḥammad.

And tomorrow I will have a son and I will take my son and I will write down his name there (in the family tree). – Formerly there was no family name. – There was not family name, instead one said Ibrāhīm son of Mḥammad, Mḥammad son of Bōzaw, Bōzaw son of Maḥmūd. And it continued like this. In a genealogy there is a family tree, in the tribes everybody has a genealogy.

For example, we Bani ʕIǧil, our genealogy goes back to whom? It goes back to Imam Ḥusayn, from him we descend. We have it in our our genealogy. Our ancestors descend from Imam Ḥusayn and it continues like this.

Geneology means kütük. When one gets lost and they find him, they come to the tirbe and say, “From whom (descends) this man?” The tribe takes out the genealogy and looks him up: From whom is he? From which place is he?
